channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Feuding Founders of Two Sigma Hedge Fund Stepping Down
item.description: The founders of hedge fund Two Sigma have agreed to step down, resolving a long-running feud between the quant-trading pioneers.

item.title: Lego revenue jumps 13% in first half of 2024, boosted by Lego Fortnite and diverse brick sets
item.description: Lego said revenue during the first six months of the year jumped 13%, reaching 31 billion Danish krone, or about $4.65 billion.

item.title: Two Businessmen Sentenced to Prison Over 1MDB Fraud
item.description: Tarek Obaid and Patrick Mahony helped Malaysian financier Jho Low steal and launder $1.8 billion, a Swiss court found.

item.title: Foot Locker shares drop 12% despite first comparable sales growth in six quarters
item.description: Foot Locker has spent two years transforming its business, and it's now seeing sales and margins expand, indicating its efforts are finally starting t...

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch plunge 15% after CEO warns of 'increasingly uncertain environment'
item.description: Abercrombie & Fitch has become one of Wall Street's biggest retail winners and the company plans to keep up the growth by expanding into international...

item.title: Tool Up for Lower Rates With Stanley Black & Decker
item.description: Having gone through cost cutting, the toolmaker is poised to benefit from a housing rebound.

item.title: Nvidia has become world's 'most important stock,' adding pressure to upcoming earnings report
item.description: Nvidia has been the primary beneficiary of the AI boom, as a handful of the richest technology companies order billions of dollars of the company's pr...

item.title: Credit Scores Without Debt? Fintech Cards Baffle Credit Industry
item.description: So-called credit-builder cards let users deposit money to pay bills. The fintechs say this counts as borrowing. The companies that create credit score...

item.title: JD.com shares climb after announcing $5 billion share buyback, outperforming decline in Hang Seng
item.description: The announcement is JD.com's second buyback this year, after announcing a $3 billion buyback in March.
